security_audit.summary: Only documentation content was found in the skill directory. No file access, environment harvesting, or execution logic was present.

content.user_title: Upgrade React projects with modern patterns
content.value_statement: Legacy React code slows upgrades and introduces breaking changes. This skill gives clear steps to move to hooks and React 18 features.
actual_capabilities: Explain React 16 to 18 upgrade steps and breaking changes
Show class component to hooks conversions with examples
Describe React 18 root API and concurrent features usage
Provide codemod commands for automated refactors
Outline performance patterns with memoization and code splitting
Illustrate TypeScript migration patterns for React components
limitations: Does not execute codemods or modify repositories directly
Requires your project context to map advice to your codebase
Does not validate runtime behavior or test results

prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a safe upgrade path from React 16 to React 18 for a small app with minimal downtime.

prompt_templates.title: Class to hooks map
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to convert a class component with state and lifecycle methods to hooks.

prompt_templates.title: React 18 features

output_examples.input: Give me a checklist to upgrade a React 17 app to React 18.
output: Update react and react-dom to 18 with matching types
Switch to createRoot API and test in StrictMode
Verify batching behavior and fix any side effects

best_practices: Upgrade incrementally and test after each step
Validate behavior in StrictMode before release

faq.question: What React versions are supported?
faq.answer: The guidance covers React 16 to 18 upgrade paths and React 18 features.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: It does not run codemods or verify builds or tests for you.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my repo?
faq.answer: It provides guidance and commands, but you must run them in your environment.

faq.question: Does it access my data?
faq.answer: No. The skill content is static and does not read files or send data.

faq.question: What if my app breaks after upgrade?
faq.answer: Review breaking changes, test in StrictMode, and address side effects step by step.

faq.question: How is this different from a linter?
faq.answer: It explains upgrade strategy and patterns rather than enforcing code rules.
